WG_HOST.description: Enter your WAN IP (externally visible IP), or a Dynamic DNS hostname.
WG_HOST.label: WAN IP [e.g. vpn.myserver.com]

PASSWORD_HASH.description: Enter an administrator password hash for the WebUI login (see Rockon description for hash generation).
PASSWORD_HASH.label: WebUI admin password hash

WG_DEVICE.description: Ethernet device the wireguard traffic should be forwarded through.
WG_DEVICE.label: Ethernet Device [e.g. eth0]

WG_DEFAULT_ADDRESS.description: Clients' IP address range, using x for the last octet.
WG_DEFAULT_ADDRESS.label: Client Address Space [e.g. 10.8.0.x]

WG_DEFAULT_DNS.description: DNS server(s) clients will use, separated by commas.
WG_DEFAULT_DNS.label: Default DNS Server [e.g. 1.1.1.1]

WG_ALLOWED_IPS.description: Allowed client IPs; comma separated e.g. (192.168.15.0/24, 10.0.1.0/24). For no restrictions enter (0.0.0.0/0, ::/0).
WG_ALLOWED_IPS.label: Allowed IP ranges [e.g. 192.168.15.0/24]

WG_PERSISTENT_KEEPALIVE.description: Seconds to keep the connection open. If 0 the PersistenKeepalive functionality is enabled.
WG_PERSISTENT_KEEPALIVE.label: Persistent Keepalive (e.g. 0)

WireGuard Easy.description:
The easiest way to run WireGuard VPN + a Web-based Admin UI.

Based on the official OCI image, available for amd64 and arm64 architecture.
